decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to use a combination of removal spells, counter magic, and card draw to control the tempo of the game. By utilizing cards like Ultimate Price, Grasp of Darkness, and Ruinous Path to remove threats, along with counterspells like Silumgar's Command and Transgress the Mind to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the card advantage provided by Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Read the Bones allows the player to outvalue their opponent over time. The deck also includes powerful threats like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Dragonlord Silumgar to close out the game.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize green ramp cards like Explosive Vegetation and Ruin in Their Wake to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful threats like Dragonlord Atarka and Chandra, Flamecaller. The deck also includes a few control elements like World Breaker and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to deal with opposing threats. The strategy is to establish board presence early with ramp spells and then close out the game with big, impactful creatures and powerful planeswalkers.

This deck focuses on using a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing efficient threats like Tireless Tracker and Sylvan Advocate, along with disruption like Ultimate Price and Ruinous Path, the deck can apply constant pressure on the opponent while also being able to handle their threats. The inclusion of Dragonlord Silumgar and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet provides additional versatility and power to the deck, giving it the tools to close out games quickly. The deck aims to set a fast pace and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and planeswalkers to quickly overwhelm your opponent. By playing aggressive cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn, combined with support from Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Sylvan Advocate, you can build a strong board presence early on. Declaration in Stone and Stasis Snare help to deal with opponent threats, while Secure the Wastes can provide a quick army of tokens. The mana base is designed to support the deck's two-color requirements efficiently. The goal is to establish dominance on the battlefield and close out the game swiftly.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on using a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Flamecaller and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, along with strong creatures like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Dragonlord Silumgar, to stabilize the game and eventually take over with powerful late-game threats. The deck also includes a mix of spot removal and sweepers to deal with opposing threats, while also disrupting the opponent's hand and graveyard with cards like Transgress the Mind and Ruinous Path.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly with creatures like Gideon, Nissa, and Archangel Avacyn. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Dromoka's Command, and token generators like Hangarback Walker and Secure the Wastes. The deck also includes some utility cards like Oath of Nissa and Evolutionary Leap to help maintain card advantage and consistency. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of Forests, Plains, and dual lands.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with creatures like Loam Dryad and Cryptolith Rite to cast big spells like Collected Company and Eldrazi Displacer. The key synergy is sacrificing creatures like Catacomb Sifter and Brood Monitor to generate value with cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Westvale Abbey. Reflector Mage and Duskwatch Recruiter provide tempo and card advantage, while creating a wide board presence with Elvish Visionary. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays and efficient creature interactions.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on developing a strong board presence and quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Thraben Inspector, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Reflector Mage. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Tireless Tracker and Archangel Avacyn provide additional value and resilience to removal spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board control to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Cryptolith Rite to ramp up mana quickly and cast high-impact creatures like Eldrazi Skyspawner and Dragonlord Atarka. By combining mana acceleration with creatures that have powerful abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Collected Company allows for additional creature presence on the board, while Reflector Mage and Eldrazi Displacer provide disruption to the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on generating early pressure and maintaining board control to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Transgress the Mind and Anguished Unmaking, removal spells like Languish and Ruinous Path, and card advantage engines like Read the Bones and Planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. By controlling the board with removal and sweepers, generating card advantage, and ultimately out-valuing the opponent, this deck seeks to grind out a win through attrition and resource management. Additionally, the inclusion of Westvale Abbey provides a potential win condition in Ormendahl, Profane Prince.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and tokens, utilizing cards like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate. The plan is to overwhelm the opponent with a wide range of threats while also protecting key creatures with cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn. Secure the Wastes and Evolutionary Leap are used for additional token generation and card advantage, keeping the pressure on the opponent and maintaining board control. The deck aims to win the game through quick and efficient aggression.

The main concept of this Naya Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game by playing efficient threats like Sylvan Advocate and Archangel Avacyn. The deck also includes removal spells like Stasis Snare and Silkwrap to deal with opposing threats. Nissa, Vastwood Seer and Nahiri, the Harbinger provide card advantage and additional threats, while Dragonlord Atarka can act as a finisher. The mana base is designed to support the three-color deck, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and removal spells.

This Izzet Control deck focuses on using counter spells and removal to control the game. It aims to ramp up its mana quickly using cards like Shrine of the Forsaken Gods and Hedron Archive to cast powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. With cards like Void Shatter and Spatial Contortion to disrupt the opponent's plans, the deck can gain an advantage and finish off the game with big creatures like Ulamog and Drowner of Hope. Jace, Unraveler of Secrets and Chandra, Flamecaller provide additional value and versatility to deal with various threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through the use of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to capitalize on synergies between various creature cards to quickly build a threatening battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of spells such as Collected Company and powerful creature abilities like Reflector Mage's bounce effect allow for versatility in dealing with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors for the deck's spells and abilities.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful aggressive creatures and planeswalkers to quickly overrun opponents with a fast and overwhelming board presence. By consistently playing threats like Archangel Avacyn, Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board dominance throughout the game. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Dromoka's Command, along with token generators like Secure the Wastes, this deck seeks to control the battlefield and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a wide board presence with resilient creatures like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate, supported by token generators like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar. Archangel Avacyn provides protection and a strong finisher, while Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone offer removal and control options. The mana base is designed to support the deck's Selesnya color identity, ensuring consistent access to both green and white mana sources for casting the powerful spells and creatures in this aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence with low-cost creatures and pump them up with anthem effects like Thalia's Lieutenant and Always Watching. This aggro strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with small but powerful creatures like Knight of the White Orchid and Hanweir Militia Captain. The deck also includes removal spells like Declaration in Stone to clear the way for attacks. Overall, this Weenie White deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with low-cost creatures and utilize Cryptolith Rite to generate mana, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Collected Company and Eldrazi Displacer. The key strategy is to sacrifice your creatures for value with cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk, while also generating additional creatures with cards like Catacomb Sifter and Brood Monitor. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful synergies.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal spells like Anguished Unmaking, Transgress the Mind, and Ruinous Path, while drawing cards and gaining card advantage with Read the Bones. The deck aims to control the board with sweepers like Languish and Planar Outburst, and powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Grim Nemesis, Ob Nixilis Reignited, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. Westvale Abbey provides a late-game win condition, while a mix of removal spells and instant-speed interaction like Secure the Wastes and Grasp of Darkness help maintain board control.
